description:
Messier 60 (M60 or NGC 4649) is an elliptical galaxy in Virgo.  It lies about 55   million light years away.  Sharing the field is NGC 4647 which together make up Arp 116.  Although these galaxies appear to overlap, little evidence of gravitational interaction is seen.  However, recent studies with the Hubble Space Telescope show some signs of interactions beginning.
 
Date: Feb 27-Mar 16 2018
Location: Blue Mountain Vista Observatories,New Ringgold PA

Optics: Celestron EdgeHD 1100 on Paramount MX
Camera: Sbig STL-11000 for RGB

Optics: Starizona Hyperion f/8 12.5 inch, FL 2540 mm on Paramount ME
Camera: Apogee U8300 for Lum

Exposure: LRGB  L:34x11 min R:22x10 min, G:19x10 min, B:17x10 min Total 15.9 hrs (92 subs at an avg of 622 sec)

Processing: Image acquisition using CCD Autopilot. Initial processing was done using Maxim DL with subsequent processing with Photoshop.
title: M60
